alert.note: Alert for Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 31 at 8:24PM PDT until April 03 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches. * WHERE...Eastern Jackson County including Butte Falls and Prospect. Highways 62 north of Prospect, 140 near the Cascades foothills, and highway 227 north of Trail. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall will be heaviest tonight into Saturday morning. Moderate to occasionally heavy snow is expected to persist Saturday into Monday morning. Road snow accumulations are likely to occur at night, with mainly wet roads, except in sun sheltered areas during the day. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
